  3684. It is very quiet which I really could care less about
  3685. entire thing feels much weaker, smaller and junkier than the previous model I received in 2000.
  3686. I'm used to, but it takes longer than normal due to the unit's low power.
  3687. A 5 or 10 minute emmergency charge is fine, so its not a great problem.
  3688. On one of them the screen wore out fairly quickly and the other just didn't shave close or efficiently enough and pulled whiskers enough to cause slight pain.
  3689. This shaver does a pretty decent job, the exception being that the rotary end has a tough time getting all the hairs on my neck without giving me massive razorburn
  3690. The one negative is that the top pops open fairly easily in luggage or when haphazardly placed in my bathroom drawer.
  3691. Amazing..I only charged it once as I am a fast shaver, because even when it loses life, the next day it still will power on for little under a minute (just enough for me to finish a quick shave)....
  3692. Lasts quite a long time per charge, stays relatively sharp after some use, and overall it's served me very well.
  3693. This razor also shaves much closer with little effort.
  3694. I think it is good, but it is a little expensive for me.
  3695. I am very surprised by the comments of other reviewers that the battery capacity is not up to expectation.
  3696. I saw the good reviews and some bad reviews having to do with cuts and nicks.
  3697. I read all the reviews, good and bad, on this product before purchasing.

All Reviews

  1. bought this one to replace an older model that broke, so far works really well.
  2. Shaves smooth easy to clean light in the hand. I would give it 5 stars but it does not have a warning light to let you know how much battery is left.
  3. It cuts pretty good and close for an electric shaver. Better than my past electric models.<br />It's charge has lasted a few shaves now and still going strong. So, I gave it the fourth star.<br />it don't beat a straight razor for smoothness. Had it about a month now.
  4. it is best for shaving your head. i like it as slick bald as i can get it and this cuts closer than a blade with no nicks, no shaving cream. not as good on the face
  5. I've used Norelco shavers for over 30 years. I was convinced to try a Braun shaver - expensive with great ratings. A disaster. The Norelco is quiet, simple and best of all gives a great shave. This is a great shaver at a great price.
  6. I had this shaver for a couple years, and then it caught on fire while I was using it. No kidding. Smoke started coming out of the top of it while I was shaving.<br /><br />And it never really shaved that well to begin with.
  7. Super product. Works great on my legs (female). Do not spend more than you have to buying a shaver for women.
  8. I waited a few months to write a review on this because I had heard about the battery life going down after a few months of use, however, this report of the battery life I found was completely false. I've had this unit since March and the battery still lasts as long as the day I received it, I recently went on a 3 week business trip for work and forgot the charger cord and it lasted the whole trip on one full charge. The only complaint I have is that the pop up trimmer isn't positioned on the unit so that you can be precise but that's a small price to pay for the rest the unit has to offer. I personally believe it gives a closer shave than my old 4 blade razor. Excellent shaver for the price. Can't be beat!
  9. My husband is home bound so this is great for him. He shaves every day and I like the fact that it can be rinsed in hot water.
  10. Works great and price is reasonable. Am replacing an old one that lasted a long time.<br /><br />Why pay big bucks for razors that provide almost not additional performance.
  11. This is a birthday gift for my husband. He likes it so much. The only concern I have it this model does have a stand for the shaver; it would be much nicer if the shaver can stand on the bathroom counter.
  12. I am actually a barber and i need to buy one of these a little more often than the average person that uses it for personal use. I only stay with the NORELCO brand tho. I like their products and they always last. This one from the gate gives a really smooth shave. I have been using it for 2 months straight, 5 days a week on people and the blades are still sharp. If it lasts me a year or two for my job, then it can last like up to 5 years for personal use. Definitely a good buy!
  13. Dissappointing from previous Norelco shavers owned. Very slow charge, simply acceptable performance. Go for the upper mid-level price shavers.
  14. Very good for travels. Could be easier to clean inside, but does a very good job. I recommend.
  15. This shaver is the reason I won't ever buy a shaver from Philips Norelco. This is the second one I bought. When I bought this one I thought Philips would have improved the shaver. The problem: you will need, good luck, the instructions, a magnifying glass, and a close-up shot of the shaver heads, once you open the top and the heads and entire assembly falls out. And if you don't have those items, good luck trying to reassemble the shaver head. Philips could easily have made an easy to re-assemble shaver. The assembly in this one is plastic junk. Do not buy this shaver.
  16. An excellent shaver. Cuts close with minimum passes, a trimmer that is easy to use, and easy to clean under warm running water. Comfortable and secure in the hand. About two weeks between charges. Cordless, but if the battery dies during a shave, can be used corded. Nice compact charger, selects right voltage automatically, so great for international travel. So much better than the Remington MS2-390 I ditched after just a few months. I would definitely recommend this rotary Norelco over the foil Remington. A couple of minor niggles; first, no carry case - so I'll be using that from my old Norelco that served me well for about eight years; and charge time on this new one is about eight hours - but only 40 mins on the old Norelco - is this really progress?! Include a case and faster charge and I'd give it a 5 star.
  17. I have been shaving with a blade for over forty years, and since retirement I now don't shave everyday. (Just me and my teenage son here.) Some years back I tried a budget foil shaver that torn half my face off, and later a budget rotary that was not much better. I decided to read some reviews on some expensive rotary shavers (not that I intended to spend $200+ for one) and found that all the bells and whistles on the latest models (from reviews) were more of a hassle than help. I then started looking at reviews on some moderately priced units and came across one review on the 7310 that said: \\"Norelco had it right years ago and then ruined it\\". I gave it a try and it has only been a month but so far I have been very happy with the shave. It is quiet, and shaves me as close as a blade. I have to go over my neck a couple of times (whiskers grow sideways) but I had to do that with a blade. My 17yr. old son tried it and now I will probably have to buy him one, and he has been using those fancy and expensive 5 blade Gillette razors. I only write a review if an item is really bad or pretty good. This item is pretty good and I would have given it 5 stars except after about 10 days it stopped halfway. I recharged it and it is humming again, but there should be a red warning light, although I kinda knew it was ready for a charge. I would recommend this shaver.
  18. I shaved with this for the first time yesterday. I had about 3 days worth of whiskers and it easily cut them. My prior razor was also a Norelco and I owned it for at least 3 years. It never gave me any problems at all. I am very happy with how this one is made. The pop up head is a nice feature and makes cleaning it easy. I also like having a push button to turn it on instead of sliding a switch. I am glad that I did not opt to buy anything more expensive because I don't see how I'd be any more pleased.
  19. This is the shaver for those who would rather not use a standard razor. It gets really close and you don't have press very hard to get a nice shave. Only press lightly. The motor does the rest. Great value for the money.
  20. I bought the Philips Norelco 7310 last summer and have purposely held off writing a review until I had had a chance to see the battery capacity and use it over a reasonable period. It lives up to its promises! I am very surprised by the comments of other reviewers that the battery capacity is not up to expectation. I have used the shaver every day over the course of months and have had to charge it only 5 times (almost a month per charge). The speed of the motor does seem unexpectedly slower than earlier examples of the type, but it does not affect the shave. Directions say that it can be washed under a stream of tap water to clean it and I have. That has seemed to cause no problem with the device. I have used it without problem both at home and on a sailboat (for weeks) in a salt-air environment. The shaver provides a quick close shave with little if any irritation. I hate to pass out 5-star ratings without solid justification, but this thing earns 5-stars. At the price point it is hard to beat this shaver.
  21. I got this a month ago, i let my skin get used to the razor before i reviewed it. Now i must say that the blades are VERY fragile when you open the top it can snap off instantly but you can snap it back on. Also this razor is very underpowered. What i mean by that is i have a 7 year old remington razor and the blades still work faster and i get a closer shave with it. This Philips Norelco i am only going to use as a back up because i cant see my self useing this razor daily.
  22. This shaver is the third Norelco model I've had in 15 years... and without question the best and closest shaving of all! From the side grip ridges (surrounding the head) that give an additionally secure feel to the handling... to the wash-out feature that affords easiest clean-up the 7310 is topnotch at a reasonable price! Highly recommended!
  23. (Barbara's other half) I had an older Norelco shaver that I'm sure was at least 10 years old. I had to push in on the power button to get full speed out of it and I know the blades were shot. It took me a long time to get a poor shave. I considered replacing the blades, but with the power button problem, I decided to spring. What the heck, it's only $40, where the other rotary shavers are much more. I can now get a decent shave in 1 1/2 minutes. I charged it when I first got it about a month ago and haven't recharged it yet. Great product for the price so far.
  24. This is a powerful razor and well worth the value. My only complaints would be that it is not extremely close and also is not as powerful when not plugged in. Otherwise, it is recommended.
  25. Got it as a Christmas gift, arrived in a timely manner. My honey loves it, and looks as though I paid more than it's worth!
  26. This shaver cuts almost as close as a wet shave. I'm amazed at the power of the battery. Since the initial charge, I have had at least 5 shaves and it still doesn't need a recharge yet. Amazon's shipping is also a plus.
  27. I have had many many electric razors from the expensive to the cheaper disposable head ones with the same results, DISAPPOINTMENT! But with this Philips Norelco I was pleasantly surprised. I bought it for a travel shaver when water & my blades wouldn't make sense but after using it for the 1st time I really found that I finally had a good razor that I could use all the time, toss the blades! It is really light weight & comfortably conforms to even my ole scared up tough bearded face. I get a close shave , even those pesky hairs on my neck and by my ears!! what A DELIGHT THANKS norelco......
  28. I needed to replace the shaver heads on my corded Norelco. I discovered that I could buy this new razor for about the same price as replacement heads on the old unit. Also, the new razor has the added convenience of being cordless. The new razor produces a similar shave as my old razor when the blades are new. Also, like the previous razor, the smoothness improves after a few shaves as the blades settle in. There are probably better razors out there but for this price....
  29. I received the shaver as scheduled, in manufacturer's packaging. I've been using Norelco shavers for about 30 years, with complete satisfaction. The washable feature is very nice----just rinse it under the faucet. A full charge of the battery lasts me about 10 days. The price was 10 dollars less than CVS for the same unit.
  30. I've been a seasoned and avid Norelco electric razor fan for over 25 years (still own an old 5601X which I loaned to my son), must express genuine overall disappointment in this new model. I've owned it for about 6 months now, and here are my impressions. On the positive side, the 7310XL is light-weight and the rinsable feature is a practical plus; however, the negatives far outweigh the pros. Unless I lucked out with one with an defective battery, my experience has been that after just a couple of uses (avg. 5-10 min. ea.), the razor starts to quickly lose power & requires a recharge. The quality of the shave itself is inferior to my previous Norelco's, including the 5601X. While it is quieter in operation, it invariably fails to provide a consistently smooth shave, leaving a scattering of hairs even after several passes. I agree with other reviewers that it tends to be more abrasive on the skin, certainly in comparison to the 5601X and Braun models I've owned. The plastic head cover is sturdy, but I don't like the fact that it fails to cover the entire head assembly. This model also doesn't come with a travel/storage case. It is moderately priced, but considering the Norelco reputation for excellent shavers, I only rate it as fair. Oh, the trimmer is lame, failing to provide a close trim and inevitably tipping down when encountering any shape resistance.
  31. You can spend a lot more for an electric razor, but why should you? This is my second Norelco shaver, and since my first, the technology has gotten better to provide an even closer shave! The new \\"flip top\\" design and the ability to rinse it under running water makes cleaning a breeze.
  32. This electric razor is OK; if it is all you can afford it is way better than a razor but not nearly as nice as the slightly more expensive norelcos. I accidently bought this lower end one without looking at the razor face.
  33. I purchased this for my teenage son several months ago as a birthday gift. He did not like to take the time to shave with cream and a razor and really wanted an electric one. I bought this one based upon price and recommendations from some of his friends. It turned out to be the perfect selection for him. Sorry I can not list specifics on controls or usage, but it has been perfect for my 16 year old son that sometimes goes a little too long between shaves!
  34. I have used several Norelco shavers in the past and have always been impressed by their coverage, speed, comfort, ease of use and maintenance. I have used both rotary and foil shavers and I have discovered that rotary usually does a better job overal to help me maintain my profile. I'm a clean-cut guy who does not have a lot of facial hair to begin with so I don't need an heavy duty shaver to suit my needs. I own the Braun M90 (for traveling) and the Norelco 7310XL - both \\"budget\\" shavers at similar price range (under $50). This is my 3rd Norelco that I have owned and the cheapest one I have ever used. Overall, I am very happy with its performance and if I had a choice, I would always use the Norelco 7310XL over Braun M90. I only use the Braun M90 as a backup if I ever run out of battery on the Norelco and its flat profile makes it one of the best travel shavers. However, the Norelco 7310XL definitely provides better coverage, closer, faster shave and is more comfortable to use. My first impression of Norelco 7310XL is that it is much lighter than the more expensive Norelco's that I have owned. I believe the main difference is in the motor inside as other shaving-specific mechanism are very similar to the higher end models. The motor on this one is definitely weaker. More motor power provides a faster and more comfortable shaving experience. However, if you're like me who shave once or twice daily, the 7310XL should be quite suitable as you're not doing heavy duty shaving on a daily basis. I also like the fact that you can clean the inside with water. The battery life is superb. Obviously it depends on how much hair you have but for me, one full charge which takes about 8 hours to charge should last you about one month. From my personal experience, the battery actually lasts longer than the more expensive Norelco's probably because it has a smaller motor. There's no battery level indicator but it shouldn't be a problem for most people - when the battery is dead, just plug it into the wall and continue. Overall, you will get a lot of mileage out of the Norelco 7310XL for light to moderate daily grooming. Moreover, even if it happens to die after some time, you won't feel sorry for your wallet or anger towards the manufacturer. If you're looking at dollar per shave, then you'll probably find this to be one of the best deals around. Highly recommended.
  35. I purchased this product for my step-father who prefers an electric razor to the standard razor. He is so pleased with this product. It fits the requirements he had for me in that it needed to be cordless and rechargeable, water submersible and portable. He takes it with him in the car and carries it in his briefcase. Thank you for an excellent product!![[ASIN:B001AJ6YS2 Philips Norelco 7310XL Men's Shaving System]]
  36. For the price of this product compared to others of similar nature; it out-performs and is extremely reliable. This is one of very few electric razors that are both reliable and effective for daily use. Providing a close shave at a cheap price, I have yet to find a better deal. Highly Recommended.
  37. I recently purchased this shaver as a gift for my husband. He is a huge fan of Norelco products. This like all of the past Norelco products we have purchased are a great value for the quality and money spent. Karen [...]
  38. I bought this razor for my dad for Christmas and he loves it. He says it gives him a very smooth shave and it is much better than his old razor.
  39. I bought this shaver because I couldn't afford the other ones on the shelf costing hundred of dollars. I will compliment the battery life, it seems to last a very long time, which is good since it takes a very long time to shave.<br /><br />My biggest complaint is that I feel this can't be called a shaving system, as it doesn't seem to shave as much as RIP THE HAIRS OUT OF MY FACE. It is a very painful experience, but at least I don't need coffee in the morning anymore. I do need to wake up earlier however because it takes me about half an hour to shave with this torture device. The rest of my family has a bitter-sweet opinion on my relationship with the Norelco 7310XL, on the one hand, they don't have to set their alarms, much like a rooster, my screams of agony awake them everyday just before sunrise. On the other hand they my wife has assumed more than once that I was being brutally attacked by an intruder in the bathroom.<br /><br />I am saving money to purchase one that might be slightly less painful.
  40. My husband had used disposable razors for a long time because the pricey electric ones didn't do the job he expected. He decided it was time to save some money and try an electric razor again. Based on the reviews and price I ordered this one although I was skeptical of the quality because of the price. He received it and loves it. He said it was the best shaver he's ever had. Thank you Norelco for providing a good quality shaver at a very affordable price.
  41. It is cheap and really good. I loved it, I can wash it after i shave, very easy to clean. I really recommend it.
  42. I asked for this for Christmas after trying two different kinds of electric razors with straight heads. One was a men's brand and the other for women. (I hate shaving while balancing on the edge of a tub when I'm just going to put jeans on.) I found they were next to useless: they couldn't get close enough to pass the eye test and they often left my skin feeling raw because of the prongs meant to 'lift' hair. Surprisingly, this does work fairly well on my legs. Shaves considerably closer than the straight-head electric razors did. You simply have to move it in tight circles over your legs. I didn't have any irritation on my calves after using it, and no red marks.<br /><br />That said, there were problems. When I used it under my arms, I experienced my very first razor burn. And it was awful. For those women out there who might be considering using this, I don't recommend this for behind the knee, anywhere there is longish or thick hair, or anywhere with thin/sensitive skin. Rule of thumb: If you ever get red bumps in an area when you shave, even if it's a few isolated clusters, don't use this razor there.<br /><br />However, all said, this did what I wanted it for, even though it's an off-label use. I certainly don't blame it for the problems above. I also like that the head flips open to let you clean out the hair (if it's been a while since your last shave and you use this, be sure to flip it open repeatedly while you shave). It's nifty for a quick, dry shave when you're in a hurry.
  43. This is my first electric razor. I've always been weary of buying one because I heard they don't give close enough shaves (which I prefer). I usually shave every 2 days, so getting a close shave is really important to me. PROS: - Very easy to clean - Great battery life (rarely needs charging) - Does a decent job at neck area - Hasn't cut me yet CONS- - Doesn't give a close shave! - Have to shave once a day - The mustache/sideburn trimmer is pretty weak - Have to go over areas several times Overall, this product is decent. If you don't get facial hair quickly, then I would guess this would be perfect for you. I think my next electric razor will probably be a foil razor instead of this one (rotary).
  44. I bought this razor for my husband. Overall he likes it especially for the price. It doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles, just pretty basic. So if you are looking for an inexpensive decent and pretty nice looking razor...this is a good pick.

  48. I think this is a very good razor for the price. I have used it for about 3 months with no problems.
  49. I needed a replacement for my Remington that would no longer hold a charge. I decided to try a Philips Norelco, as I had never owned one. I have been using it for several weeks and am still on the first charge, which is much longer than the specifications say to expect. That is a nice plus, since I was expecting to have to charge it weekly. It is more underpowered than other cordless shavers I have owned, but it gets the job done. The pop-up trimmer is really well designed. Other shavers pop up the trimmer by pushing up, which often happens accidentally during shaving. This one is spring loaded and needs to be unlatched with a downward motion, which means no accidental pop ups. Well done, design team. I love that it is rinseable in water. Cleaning is now a breeze. As an extra perk, the high contrast color scheme looks very sharp.
  50. Short and sweet this is a great buy for the price! I don't know how much better those $160 razors can be but this thing does the job and than some especially since it has the trimmer attachment which is amazing and at this point i cannot live without, goes hand in hand after shaving!<br /><br />For all those looking to make a switch from a regular blade to electric be warned!!! Since this was my first switch I knew that normal skin adjustment time is around 2-3 weeks continual use, unfortunately with this model (and maybe thats why the more expensive razors are pricey because of the blade quality) but this particular model took me around a month in change to actually reap the benefits of a close shave. The first day I used this it my neck (i have sensitive skin) look like I broke out in massive hives, lasted about 2hrs ... i almost gave up after that but i stuck it out and respectively have grown to love the thing! I now shave on the way to work and in less than 5 mins come out with a great shave, which saves me time and the best part, no irritation anymore which is why i switched to begin with, that pays for itself!<br /><br />Lastly the fact that you can wash this thing in the sink by flipping open the cover is amazing! So easy to clean, great stuff.<br /><br />So in closing -<br /><br />-Great shave after initial getting used to (skin)<br />-No more shaving cream needed, get a shave in less than 5mins -<br />-Trimmer works where the shaver stops (almost barber quality, can be used all over body)<br />-Self sharpening blades good for a year<br />-Easy cleaning (pop head open, wash in sink, air dry, good to go)<br />-Rechargeable battery, works while charging as well, battery lasts forever! Charging indicator on power button -<br />-Feels great in hand,<br />-Price!<br /><br />-Can take up to a month for skin to get used to electric razor, (do not switch back, stick it out, very important)<br />-Can pull longer whiskers out like a tweezer, which may get annoying to those with longer stubble<br />-Unit doesn't like being in cold temps, will freeze for awhile until battery warms up (left in my car one night)<br />-May need multiple passes at times for thicker hair ...d temps, will freeze for awhile until battery warms up (left in my car one night) -May need multiple passes at times for thicker hair ...

  100. I've been using this razor daily for about a month now. The first thing you will notice is how quiet it is, followed by the great shave it provides and finally how easy it is to clean up by just running it under hot water. While charging takes about 8 hours, it stays charged for a long, long time. Since the initial charge, I've only had to charge it twice. I was using a Braun Series 1 1-150 razor (see my review) and liked it. But I found that over time, it did not shave very well under my chin and on my neck, and it took a lot of time to fully do the job correctly. Not so with the Norelco! As with all electric razors, I recommend that you use a pre-electric shave lotion (I like Afta Pre-Shave) to make the shave easier and cause less razor burn.

(As in, \\"give away the handle and charge for the blades\\"!) One charge will last for the longest trip, so you can travel light and leave the somewhat bulky charge cord at home. If you've never used a rotary shaver, you may want to use this type of razor on a regular basis (i.e. don't let your facial hair get too long, as the razor will feel like it's pulling the hair) and with a light touch.   118. I picked this up because it fit my budget and I figured I didn't need anything fancy. Now I wish I'd spent $80 on a better, more powerful model and will probably end up doing so in the next few weeks. The 7310 is really lightweight and quiet, but only because it's made of plastic and spins its blades at low speeds. Even at a full charge, this shaver pulls my whiskers after only two days of growth. Eventually I do get the smooth Norelco shave I'm used to, but it takes longer than normal due to the unit's low power. Buy this only if you're fine with taking extra time to get every hair. A better model will shave in a fraction of the time and won't pull your whiskers.
  119. This new shaver performs as well as my last Norelco, perhaps a little quicker. While it doesn't have any bells and whistles, it does a good job. I don't care for the cost of replacement blades, so I will replace the whole shaver when the blades become dull.I like the triple head shavers better than the screen type I have used before. Overall a great performer for the price
  120. Solid built. I shave everyday, the battery can last at least a week on one charge. Be aware that the shaver can not be charged during the usage. It can give you a very close shave if you use it properly.
  121. HAD MY FIRST NORELCO SHAVER FOR 8 YEARS AND WAS VERY HAPPY WITH IT. THE NEW NORELCO 7310XL IS FANTASTIC! I CAN'T BELEIVE HOW SMOOTH AND QUITE IT IS. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RAZOR.

  124. I've owned a number of electric razors over the years (including Norelco) and this, by far, is the best I've used. It's quiet and gets the job done fast. However, because it doesn't shave as close as a regular razor, I'm not giving it five stars. As long as there is metal between the blades and your face, I don't think any electric razor will ever shave as close as a regular razor. At least with this Norelco you won't have to worry about any nicks and you will get a pretty good shave.

  129. The razor is all it was advertised to be and perhaps more, based on my prior experience with Norelco electric razors. Obviously, I must like the brand or I wouldn't have returned. As to this particular razor, the first thing to report is that it is VERY quiet. One could easily use it while a partner continues to sleep nearby. Second, it shaves me quickly and thoroughly. Third, the first charge lasted through approximately 5 shaves, and when it gave out, the device quit completely (no gradual slow down like my battery powered toothbrush). When it stops, you simply plug in the charger to finish that shave. Finally, it cleans up easily. The only negative I have encountered, and this is minor, is the flashing green light when it has finished recharging. The first time I charged it, this happenend at about 2AM, and it was somewhat disconcerting to see the bathroom flashing green. I am very well pleased with the device.
  130. I have used electric shavers for many years. I looked for a reasonably priced, competent shaver. This is one.<br /><br />It shaves and trims well. It holds a charge long enough to be useful. It runs fine when plugged in, the plug is even small and light. I have only used it a few months so can't comment on long term battery or other durability. It is easily cleaned, allowing use of water. It light weight with nice balance and feel when in use. Simple to use, there are no cutting height or other adjustments but, because it is a basic shaver, others may be do some jobs better such as: extremely long/tough beards; special skin; or shaving exceptionally close. I don't need any of these so it is no problem.<br /><br />It is not fancy or loaded with 'stuff'. It just does its job. All in all a good value.<br /><br />Update 9/2012: I still use, and rinse, this shaver daily. The battery has held up well...recharge required maybe every 2 weeks or so, and again, it works when just plugged in. I will probably buy another like it when I need to.
  131. The Norelco 7310XL isn't just the best \\"budget\\" shaver, it's as good if not better than any shaver you can buy for 10 times the money! I've tried them all, and I love its simple reliability and high quality. It reminds me of those indestructible old Norelco shavers that your dad used for 40 years, only much lighter and quieter. Why pay more for contrived gimmicks? At $29, it is a STEAL! Charges quickly, too. Just one little nit: It's plastic protective cap clasps on just above the release button that opens the razor head compartment, so remove the cap from the TOP to avoid unintentionally pressing that button and having the compartment open and the hair fall out!

  138. Being just 23 years old (yes you can roll your eyes now), I have only used two shavers in my life. Both of these have been electric razors made by Norelco. I used my previous Norelco for 4 years before it stopped holding a charge. It really didn't effect me since I always kept it plugged in when I used it. After seeing this razer at such a good price I decided it was finally time for me to step up. I like the rotary design better since it seems to give me less ingrown hairs and gives me less irritation. This product comes in the annoying safety-plastic packaging. After finally getting it open I found the razor, with a cap on the rotary part, the power cord, a pamphlet, and a cleaning brush. The razor has a very attractive design versus my last Norelco - which wasn't as visually appealing. The Noreleco 7310XL is much quieter than the version I previously had. It was able to shave VERY close. I was impressed with how close of a shave it did as such a price. Yes I would have to go over spots more than one time, but that really is to be expected with any shaving system. The razor did not irritate my skin either. After initially charging it, I have found that I rarely will have to charge this product. You can also easily clean the razor with just water. Thank goodness. Just make sure you dry it properly else it will smell terrible. Here is something important You MUST have the product be partially charged in order to actually use the Razor. Even when it is plugged into the wall. For the price, this product is extremely well worth it. When you find yourself needing a new razor blade, or if you can no longer hold a charge, you might just want to buy yourself a new razor instead.
  139. This is a pretty good razor, holds a long charge. It is extremely quiet motor, I wasn't sure it was doing the job but the stubble goes away. The reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because I don't feel it cuts as close as my old Norelco (cool-skin 6710). I used it the same way until the battery died and there wasn't a local service center. I didn't like the charger on the 6710 but I understand why they did it this way for safety.

After using it for a few months one day one of the razors somehow caught a hold of the metal screen and stuck the blades outside. Luckily I was able to pull it away from my face before the blades ripped it off. 2 of the rotors still worked so I kept on using it until I had time to go get a new razor. The next day another rotor violently exploded inside sending pieces of plastic and a spring flying. Would not recommend to anyone, even someone on a budget.

  159. The first thing you'll notice is how quiet this shaver is, compared with earlier designs. If you detest loud noises early in the morning, you'll be thrilled with this one! Like all electric shavers it takes a lot longer to get a good close shave than using a razor, and as with all electric models, it really doesn't \\"shave as close as a blade.\\" If a close shave look is preferred, you'll need to use it a few times a day to \\"touch up\\" your appearance. But it's definitely a step up from older models: there's a different sensation in the cutting action (it feels like it is shaving closer) and the blinking lights when the battery is fully charged lets you know when to unplug it. If you're choosing between refurbishing an older model with new parts, and buying new, seriously consider ordering this one, and recycling the old one.

  188. It was finally time to replace my 5-year-old shaver (blades for the discontinued model are now more than this shaver cost!) so I compared features and decided on this one. I unpacked it and plugged it in, as per the manual, to get a full charge in the battery. A few hours later, I was satisfied to see the two LEDs flashing to tell me the battery was fully charged; that happiness faded a bit when I unplugged the shaver and both lights went out. It would be a lot more helpful to have these lights stay on to let me know the state of the battery (both on = full charge, one on = getting low, one flashing = very low)! This really only leaves you with two choices...recharge the battery when it isn't very low (and this will tend to reduce the efficiency of the battery over time) or take a chance that your battery will die mid-shave and you'll have to finish your shave with the cord plugged in (this may not seem like a huge deal, but not everyone has an outlet right next to the mirror in the bathroom).<br /><br />The shave is amazing. Even the first shave was close and smooth with a minimum of \\"neck bumps\\" that you get so often from a new shaver. The reflex action heads are great compared to my old shaver's floating heads. These really keep the shaving heads aligned to your face, even under the chin. My old razor was horrible under my chin since only one head at a time was touching my skin because of all the different curves...so getting that area done took close to half my total shaving time. With this shaver, the heads seem to stay engaged with my beard all the way around so I can actually use the circular motion you're supposed to with a rotary shaver and get a good, close shave under my chin and along my jaw line with many fewer strokes.<br /><br />Besides the great shave, there are other reasons to like this shaver. It is really quiet...compared to my old Remington, this is like a car engine next to a big diesel truck. The washable design is another big plus for me...much better than relying on the little brush to get the heads clean. The design is very comfortable in my hand and doesn't require me to keep switching how I grip the shaver as I move from one part of my face to another.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Very close shave<br />Comfortable on the face and in the hand<br />Quiet<br />Seems to hold a good charge<br />Can be cleaned under running water<br /><br />Cons:<br />No battery-level lights (but even this shouldn't be an issue for most of us since we can use it corded if the battery dies mid-shave)<br /><br />I think this is very much worth the price and I recommend it.elying on the little brush to get the heads clean. The design is very comfortable in my hand and doesn't require me to keep switching how I grip the shaver as I move from one part of my face to another. Pros: Very close shave Comfortable on the face and in the hand Quiet Seems to hold a good charge Can be cleaned under running water Cons: No battery-level lights (but even this shouldn't be an issue for most of us since we can use it corded if the battery dies mid-shave) I think this is very much worth the price and I recommend it.

  194. I've had several electric razors of several different brands ranging from $20 to $80, and the Norelco 7310 is my favorite. When you turn it on it actually sounds underpowered because it's much quieter than my previous razors, but it does a surprisingly good job. In fact I think it gives me a closer shave than any of my other electric razors, particularly on my neck, which is a difficult area. The battery also lasts through several shaves, the trimmer works well, it's easy to clean, and easy to recharge. It's a great electric razor for the price.
  195. This razor cuts really well. It was half the price of my previous Norelco, and it works just as well or better. The fact that it doesn't come with a storage case seems to be the only negative, but it's a small one... I just use the case from my previous razor.
  196. This is my first electric shaver and it works wonders. If you're careless and you just start swiping at random angles you can still cut yourself though. Also, make sure you keep shaving while your hair is short. Once it gets too long, it hurts to shave with this. I also love that there's a flip thing on the other side that I can use to shape my sideburns.
  197. When I purchased this shaver I was concerned because of several low ratings some reviewers gave it at the time here on Amazon. I even bought a spare one at the time, but it likely will be some while before I need to open the box from my second one bought to replace the first, &#34;just in case.&#34; It works fine and does what a shaver is supposed to do. It is not too noisy. To me it is rather quiet. I've owned many shavers over a period of fifty years, so when I tell you this one is good, it is!

  199. First time I buy one of these Shaving System and I love it!!!   200. The Philips Norelco 7310 shaver is a basic electric shaver at an attractive price that won't hurt your wallet. Pluses (+) * Low cost * Easy to use * Very easy to clean, just rinse under faucet * Provides a reasonable shave in a decent amount of time Minuses (-) * Neck hair shaving is tedious as it takes multitudes of passes to get down to skin Overall, I would have to say that the Philips Norelco 7310 is a great buy and a great bargain. If you are looking for an electric shaver for the moments that whipping out the shaving cream takes too much time, then this is a great deal you should definitely look into.

  202. I had a Quadra Action Norelco (It cost me about 100 bones when I purchased it new) that took the HQ6 blades. I owned it 5-6 years until I dropped it and broke the head assembly. I loved that razor so much that I actually tried to by a new Head Assembly for it but they quit making them for the series I had.<br /><br />So I did reviews for two weeks on razors, not to mention called Norelco customer service 3 times to ask questions.<br />I'm going to make this easy for you:<br /><br />This Norelco model has HQ8 blades in it. Some with HQ8 blades cost a hundred bones, others 30 bones.<br />This does what any \\"high cost\\" shaver does with the same blades in it. Why? Because it's the same blades! (the main key to \\"shaving\\").<br /><br />The others might have a cooler colors, fancier looking lights, or a stand, battery meter, that don't give you a better shave, but just have added features for the pretty package wow factor.<br /><br />Myself I use my Razor to SHAVE.<br /><br />This Razor shaves just as close if not closer than my Quadra Norelco that had the HQ6 Blades in it (The blades in this are suppsed to be a steap up, but I see little difference)<br /><br />No Lie, I talked to 3 people at Norelco. And I asked them about the other \\"higher priced Norelcos\\" razors, vs this razor. (even inquired about the arcitec)<br /><br />All of them told me that the only difference was the added features (lights, bells & whistles, faster charge time), but the shave will be just as close in this one than any others they sell. (One rep even told me that the arcitec was one of there most returned razors.<br /><br />Take it for what it's worth. But for the extremely low cost on this bad boy with the High End Blades but after doing research, talking to Norelco reps I think this truly is a no brainer.<br /><br />Get this shaver, charge it up and enjoy.

  207. At the bargain price of about $25.00 that I spent, there is little if anything negative to say about this Norelco shaver.<br /><br />It uses exactly the same blades that are found in the more expensive models of the Norelco line and thus provides the same quality, close shave.<br /><br />Being able to clean the shaver after each use by simply opening up the shaving head and rinsing under water is a great convenience and time saving feature.<br /><br />If the external appearance/design of the shaver itself and some additional capabilities don't matter to you, then why spend more money ($100.00 +) to get essentially the same shave?<br /><br />Both my face and my pocketbook are extremely happy with this purchase.

  209. This is the first electric shaver i've ever bought, and I really like it. I'd always shaved the old fashioned way with dissposable razors and shaving cream, but I wanted to try something new because it takes me a long time to shave and I almost always cut myself. The shaver is liteweight, comfortable to hold, the battery holds a charge for almost two weeks, and it shaves pretty close. It doesn't get as close as a traditional razor. But on the plus side it doesn't cut your face, and the hairs gona grow back anyway so who cares! My job requires me to be \\"flexible\\" which means (my hours change every week) so one day I may not get off work until 10 at night and then I may have to be back at 8 in the morning, so its convenient (takes 2 to 3 minutes for me to shave). The 7310XL makes shaving quick and easy instead of a pain in the butt like it used to be, and before I used an electric, my skin would always break out after I shaved. But since I started using this shaver my skin doesn't break out as bad as it used to. The 7310XL is fast, easy to use, and easy to clean. So if your sick of cutting your face and your not real picky about how close the shave is I recommend you buy it.

  211. This shaver is worth what you pay but it does have its flaws. I just figured that all the electric shavers seemed to have the same problems so why not get the cheapest. I think I made the right decision because this shaver does a decent job and its very convenient which is why I wanted to go electric. It does seem to have trouble around on the neck and around the jaw line so you can end up taking quite a while shaving if you want to get it perfect. Also you have to get into the habit of shaving daily so if you don't like doing that you might want so get something else. The shaver can pluck hairs that are longer than a cm in length which is rather unpleasant. Stubble though it handles just find and I haven't had any irritation despite this being my first electric shaver.
  212. I never remembered a time when shaving was a pleasant experience. I still have adult acne and a razor blade always give me nicks, cuts, & the occasional razor burns. I especially hate it when I have acne since I sometimes cut them. Yes, I have been careful, I also take a hot shower or wash my face with hot water and put shaving cream before shaving. Plus it's really hard to see where your small acne are with the shaving cream hence the occasional cut. I hated shaving & only shave 2x/week which means I have a couple of days wherein I have a day old beard/mustache. So I was looking to switch to an electric razor. I was a bit apprehensive when I bought this since I thought that it could never replace a good razor shave. I've been using this for over a month now and I could say what a difference! I don't dread shaving as much as I did before and I can shave as many times as I can without the nicks, burns, cuts, and pain! No more preparations, not even a shaving cream, and it glides easily over my face AND over my acne without cutting them. I've only charged my unit once when I received it and it's been over a month now and it hasn't needed a charge yet. My only regret is why I didn't get this sooner.

  222. Today I saw the Philips Norelco 7310XL in a nearby store at a cost of 700 RMB (almost 110 USD). I had no idea this kind of razor cost that kind of money in China. It's quiet, lightweight, and has no vibration unlike the Panasonic ES-SA40-K shaver I own. It is fully washable, has a corded option if your charge runs out, and possesses a pop-up trimmer to groom mustaches and sideburns. Additionally, there is a battery full light and LED power indicator. Should the razor stop functioning within two years, the warranty comes in handy.<br /><br />Although the shaving heads automatically adjust to the shape of your face and neck, the razor does take a little time to get that smooth face my wife desires. You are not going to get the closest shave with this product, but this razor isn't the best that money can buy. It's a nice electric razor with a lot of options. For optimum performance, I recommend using the razor with shaving cream.

  246. Pros:<br />It shaves slightly closer than my previous Norelco 5801.<br /><br />It's relatively cheap. My 5801 cost $63.00 ten years ago. And, it's much cheaper than the Braun and Panasonic I considered. Braun probably shaves closer, but the price difference is not worth it to me.<br /><br />It's even quieter than my 5801. Far quieter than Remington shavers I've heard, and likely much quieter than Panasonic.<br /><br />The charge initially lasted 9 days, but improved to 14--the same as my previous 5801.<br /><br />Cons:<br />It looks cheap and feels cheap. Part of this judgment is likely because it feels significantly lighter than my Norelco 5801. However, when I weighed both, the 7310 weighed 6.3 ounces, and the 5801 weighed 6.9 ounces. Half of this minor weight difference is because the 7310 has an external transformer, while the 5801 has a built-in transformer. I prefer the built in transformer and the simple, coiled cord with the 5801<br /><br />The hinged, not easily removable head is annoying. The 5801 was so much easier to clean.<br /><br />For the money, I would get a 7310 again. But, why keep changing something that works well and looks fine?<br /><br />My 5801 lasted ten years. We'll see how long this one lasts.

  259. To begin, I take a blood thinner and avoid using a blade to minimize nicks and bleeding. Over the years I've used many electric razors and prefer the Norelco design. So when it came time to replace my old and ailing shaver, I looked at the mind boggling choices on the market today with their dazzling array of features. I no longer travel much, so fast charging wasn't an option I needed. And I wasn't interested in digital readouts of battery charge, etc. After reading all the reviews, I chose the model 730XL; it had the same cutting mechanism as the high priced models, but without the bells and whistles. How does it work? For me, the best Norelco I've ever owned. It's very quiet and cuts my medium light beard as well as a blade, in my opinion. (I do use a skin lubricant: Williams Lectric Shave. Besides absorbing moisture on the skin, it coats with a light lubricant. Also, my wife likes the scent!) I also like the idea of cleaning the head by rinsing with water after a shave. The trimmer also cuts closer than the old Norelco. My only negative comment is that the spider that holds in the shaving heads seems flimsy and prone to breaking. time will tell.

  266. In December 2011, I purchased this shaver on sale at Target for $27.99. For the money this is a very good shaver. It does appear under powered but it does the job of providing a close shave in two minutes but not a comfortable one. However if you use some shave talcum powder or even regular powder the shave is much smoother. At this time I have used the shaver for 10 days but had previously used a Norelco so my face should not need to make an adjustment as recommended by Norelco. This shaver is difficult to clean because when opened the 3 rotor posts are in a recessed well that makes it difficult to clean out the whiskers. I often read that an electric shaver does not shave as close as a wet shave with a safety razor and that is true. But is there any electric razor that shaves as close as a safety razor. Of course the term \\"close shave\\" has many different interpretations and how close of a shave do us men need? When I bought these razor I was skeptical of it's performance based on the price but I know I can return the shaver to Norelco withing in 45 days for a full refund. I have bought more expensive electric razors from Remington, Panasonic and Braun but at 3 times price but not 3 times the performance. My goal was to buy an electric shaver that is inexpensive, gives a good shave and I don't have to spend $30 plus for replacement blades. When the shaver heads to need to be replaced I can toss the shaver and buy another Christmas special that may offer improved features.
  267. I bought this shaver in December for the purpose of using it occasionally to spruce up in the afternoon or evening when I have to go out in public for special occasions, (which doesn't happen very often). Using a blade razor twice in one day tends to be brutal, especially if you have sensitive skin. I have had a few electric shavers, but have found that they take too long to do the job. I still prefer a triple blade razor because it's so much faster. Having read some of the reviews, I wouldn't even try to shave with this electric shaver if I let my beard grow two or more days, because it would probably not get the job done. However, it has been great for touch up. The thing I like best about it is that it is the quietest shaver I've had so far, probably because the motor runs rather slowly. The motor is probably not as powerful as some on the market, but this is a trade off for its quiet operation. I am losing my hearing, so the quiet motor is, to me, the best feature of this shaver. For occasional use, it does fine, but beyond that, I can't say. The low price is the reason I bought it in the first place. As the old saying goes - you get what you pay for - probably applies here. If you need a quiet electric shaver and want it for occasional use, this might be the one for you.
  268. Bought this for my son for his birthday. He would give it 5 stars. close shave, great trimmer. Good Value
  269. I've used electric razors all my life and I've used this one for a few days and so far it's the best once I've used. Here are the best features I've noticed so far. 1. QUIET! It's so quiet that I can shave while my wife sleeps nearby. 2. Like most, this unit has an extending blade to trim side burns etc. 3. You can charge and shave at the same time. 4. It's waterproof so it's easier to clean up. 5. Price / Value. I paid $35 at a local big box retailer. Just a side note, like all units, the cost of the replacement foils are insane. The entire unit cost $35 while the replacement foil cost $37!
  270. This is a great buy for a pretty adequate electric shaver. I purchased this as a back up to a previous purchase of the same item (at the same cost). It is cheaper to buy this whole shaver than to get new shaver blades for my old Norelco. Does a very adequate job of shaving off m daily whiskers.
  271. I'm not going to lie but it will cause a little neck irritation but not more then shaving with a manual razor. I would recommend this razor if you on a budget.
  272. I love this shaver! Cuts close as a blade and is easily the best razor I have ever owned. Is very quiet and holds a charge for about 2 weeks.
  273. I had doubts about this product because of the low price. If it didn't work well I thouight that I would return it since I bought it with a credit card. Well, what a surprise. It is great. So quiet that I thought something was wrong. It gives a very fast. close shave. Lasts a long time before necessary to charge. Amazon price was best.
  274. I love this shaver! I have used Norelco Triple-Head shavers since 1971 at age 16. This is my 5th shaver in all that time. They last for years, give a close shave and are very durable. 2 of my last 4 shavers were replaced not because they needed to be, but simply because I had received a new one as a gift or I'd probably still be using them. They last and last. The one major mistake most guys make with electric shavers is pressing them too hard against the face as they use them; this results in irritation and they give up and go back to old-fashioned razor blades. Just press it lightly against the face so the heads can float freely and do the job they were designed to do, and you'll quickly fall in love with how quickly you can shave in the morning without having the mess of shaving cream or gels to deal with!
  275. I don't charge it after the 4 uses as recommended. I keep using it. I also use standard disinfectant/lube to clean the blades (highly recommended for any razor). I have long hair so in order to use a shaving system I have to put it back in order to shave. If you let your hair face hair grow than the edger comes in real handy. It will get your hair back to a length that the regular razor can use. Its my first attempt at real electric razors. I've had one before but didn't use it because it left me stubbly. Everyone says you need to use a razor a few times to break it in. So I tried that and it seems to work, but you have to continually shave every day, or two days or it'll take two pass through's next time to get yourself smooth. Overall, I approve.
  276. I bought this as a gift and I've been told it's wonderful! Even better than the 7110x that the person originally wanted.
  277. I bought two Philips Norelco in December, one this and another 1150x/40 SensoTouch 2d Electric Shaver, and payed like three times more for that SensoTouch 2d. I have never used electric shavers before so to compare these two: although 7310 is cheaper, it is better, more convenient, shaves better. It is far from the perfect and not for close shaving but for price it is good.
  278. I have used 3 different Norelco electric shavers and this is a bottom line shaver. After going on a trip, I lost my previous Norelco and had to get a replacement. I figure getting this as a value shaver. You really do get what you pay for. The entire construction seems flimsy and plastic-ie. At least, my previous shaver had some metal parts and had some real weight to it. Anyhow, the shaving head speeds seem to be slower than usual, but for me, it gets the job done. The trimmer is comparable with my previous one. Finally, the water cleaning function is nice. I would recommend this as a backup or travel shaver and just spend more for a top of the line shaver.
  279. I've been using electric rotary razors for many years now. My previous Norelco Spectra 8865XL was not cheap, but worked quite well until recently when it needed battery replacement. That's a nuisance with these Norelco razors (and maybe with other brands) since you have to solder the leads onto the battery. After some Amazon review research I decided to try this 7310XL though at its relatively low price I wasn't too hopeful. It arrived quickly in good shape (usual Amazon service) and when I use it right (the instructions with it are fine, and nothing unusual) it does an amazingly good job. The claim that it gets at the hairs even below skin level may be correct: next morning there's much shorter hairs to shave than with previous razors, including my previous Norelco; if in a real rush I might even be able to skip it! Its also very light and relatively quiet.
  280. Long ago, I used to shave manually with Shick razors and did not like it. They would leave red marks on my skin with an uncomfortable feeling and would always cut myself in the process. Some time later, I upgraded to a Remington electric razor. The same situation happened due to my sensative skin but no cuts. Plus, my shave would not always get the facial hair around my face. I finally broke down and ordered this electric razor. Reading reviews first, I was skeptical buyimg it (but finally did). I've used it for almost three months and am very pleased with the resaults. Every time I shave, I don't have red marks on my skin and this razor gets the job done. Plus, clean up is fairly easy with little hassle. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend this to anyone who wants a clean comfortable feeling on their skin.
  281. This shaver is the best shave I have ever had with an electric razor and the cleaning function is absolutely the best. I would recommend this shaver to anyone who would ask.
  282. not as good as my old norelco, but this will do for the price, not as close shave as I like. battery life is good, haven't charged after 10 use. easy to clean, just run it under water.
  283. This shaver goes a long time on a charge. It shaves pretty close but it is sometimes difficult to get the whiskers just under my nose.
  284. After reading other reviews, I was expecting the shaver to be \\"ok.\\" Frankly, I am surprised at how well it shaves and how quiet it is compared to other shavers. I have been using Braun foil shavers for a while, which remind me a bit of jet engines winding up. The 7301XL, in contrast, seems so slow and quiet that I thought there was a problem when I first fired it up.<br /><br />Braun shavers require one to push pretty firmly with repeated strokes to get a close shave. The 7310XL, in contrast, shaves close with hardly any pressure at all, a welcome difference. I think it shaves closer. Norelco's system has trumped Braun, in my book.<br /><br />The head easily hinges open for cleaning, and one quick rinse under the faucet does the job. They do suggest you leave it unhinged and open to dry, which is awkward.<br /><br />I have no reservations about this shaver. For such a reasonable price, it performs well.
  285. This is the first time I am trying an electric razor and it causes a lot of burns. I tried it 3 times and then decided it was enough and switched over to Mach3. I will stick onto to Mach3.
  286. After fifteen shaves, I finally had to recharge. Shaves much better than my old fixed-head Norelco. Occasionally pulls hair--not good.
  287. I have used electric shavers for many years, mostly Norelco triple headers, and always the least expensive available (sometimes refurbished), and have always been satisfied. They shave well and last for a reasonably long time, and when the shaving heads/blades get dull, I just get another one because the replacements cost as much as I paid for the razor. A couple of years ago I tried a refurb Remington non-triple header because of the price, and within a few weeks the metal? coating started to come off the head and scrape me during the shave. Thinking that all triple headers were pretty much alike, I got a new, more expensive Remington triple header at a department store, but it has a very flawed design. The heads kept falling out, and were hard to get back in, and it was kind of hard to clean. Finally one of them wouldn't stay in at all, so I used it with two heads for a while, and then another one fell out while using it away from home, and I never found it. Even with all three heads working, it just didn't shave very close. Hoping that they weren't really all alike, I ordered this Norelco from Amazon. I found it by clicking the \\"used\\" link, but it arrived sealed in original packaging, with just a little dent in the outer box. After using it for a couple of weeks now, I am completely happy with it. It is a totally different, solid design, and is also much easier to clean. It is fairly quiet, and shaves quickly and well. I've never used an expensive shaver, for comparison, but if this one lasts like my previous Norelcos did, I can't imagine ever paying more, or ever, ever going back to Remington.
  288. My husband usually hates to shave but now does not mind at all. He gets a smooth shave in a fraction of the time and has had no issue with irritation. Worth the money.
  289. Philips Norelco 7310 is fast, quite and has an excellent build quality. The display is amazing with good colors and contrast. Battery life is exceptionally good.
  290. I've been using Norelco triple header razors since about 1975. Each one continues to surprise me; perhaps it's because when new, it really does shave as close as most blade shaves. It's hard to determine when the shave deteriorates; it happens so slow, that it takes years to notice that my blade shaves are becoming better, or rather that the Norelco is slowly getting duller. Of course, by that time, the shaver is obsolete and blades for it become hard or impossible to find, which makes a new Norelco seem like a better investment. But none of the razors ever really died, they just got replaced by a new one. As I work in a hospital, I bring the old ones to give to patients who are on blood thinners and can't use blades, so none of them ever go to waste even if they don't give a perfect close shave anymore. So, this time I'm going to be prepared; I'm ordering extra blades as I buy the razor. Of course, if the razor dies, I'm screwed with obsolete blades, but then again I guess I can always sell them to someone else on ebay if that does occur. Now more on the review. This razor seems a little different than my previous Norelcos; it doesn't seem to be spinning as fast. Never the less, I'm getting a very close shave in a very short time, with no razor burn (and I have very sensitive skin). One thing I have to mention is like anything else, you have to develop the technique over time to get the best results with this razor, but I think that applies to everything in life. Just to back up my review, I'm going to buy three of these to give as presents for Christmas this year. They're that good. Now I have to search for a cigarette lighter adapter for it for the car when I go camping.

  295. I am not about to spend money on those really high dollar shavers. This one is replacing my two old 7240XL's I have had for ever it seems. I think this 7310XL shaves better then the older ones when they were new. I am pleased! Chris W.
  296. This is a frustrating shaver. It IS a close shave, but it doesn't do well with anything past the 5 o'clock shadow. If you skip a day of shaving, you'll probably need to use the trimmer first. And that's where the design flaw is; the trimmer is useless.<br /><br />Previous models had a sliding activating mechanism that would lock the trimmer into place, preventing it from moving while you used it. This model relies on a spring mechanism to keep the trimmer engaged, making it extremely flimsy. Any pressure in the wrong direction and the trimmer folds back down. This makes trimming the hair on your neck almost impossible, and if you shower before you shave and have any residual moisture on your face, the trimmer can't cut it.<br /><br />So while I am (at best) satisfied with the shave, this razor almost requires a separate trimmer to be of any value if you don't plan on shaving every day religiously.
  297. Purchased this for my husband over a year ago. He shaves daily and has commented that he loves the close shave that this gives. He has sensitive skin and previous shavers have ripped his face up pretty good, but this hasn't. Prior to this, I had purchased him a foil strip style shaver that broke after a year. He prefers the closeness of the rotary shaver over the strip. This is the first shaver he's had that he doesn't constantly complain about. It gets five stars from me because it still works, I don't have to deal with scratchies from his face, AND because I don't have to listen to him complaining.
  298. It's a nice device. And it's very smooth to use. Especially the battery, it can last very long. Since I got it, I shaved for two or three weeks now, but I still haven't charged once. It's worth the money.

  305. This Norelco 7310XL does an excellent job of sharpley cutting away the face hair. And it cost me only about $35, a far cry from the many Norelcos that are touted and can cost approximately $200. This Norelco is excellent in its simplicity. It does not have those many sophisticated automated lighted controls--it simply does the shaving well. When you open the razor up, it gives you the impression of being made with basic materials. It does not have the luxurious display to indicate to you that the charge is about to expire. You mostly have to estimate on your own that the device requires recharging. Yet, this Norelco does a much better job at trimming the beard than many much more expensive Norelcos that I have used. Also, your chin will feel a bit of irritation wnen you first use this razor; but after a couple of weeks, that feeling of chin irritation will be gone. The razor is also easy to clean and disassemble. All in all you get an inexpensive basic razor that performs excellently. No frills, but the job gets done! And it seems that the razor is durable enough to last for a long time. I bought the razor, based on the good reviews. The reviews are so many, and the price of the razor has noticeably gone up! A testimony to the high and rising demand!

What happens is that your hair actually gets wrapped around the blades when they become dull enough. One reason I choose electric shavers is because when I wet-shave in the morning the evening stubble is really like sandpaper and I get complaints from my significant other when we become cuddly. An electric shaver uses a different cutting style so the after-eight stubble is acceptable and I don't get sent out for an evening shave. My old Panasonic was loud, but this is quiet. My old Panasonic gave a nice close shave, while this shaver is somewhat decent. I would NOT say it \\"lifts and cuts\\", though the motor speed is so slow I need to shave at least twice a week or else the hairs will pull. My old Panasonic would start pulling after a week of no shaving, but still not as bad.   337. I bought this to replace an ancient Norelco electric - plug in the wall type - before batteries type - which had razors that'd never been replaced in ten years' use. You would have thought I'd be overjoyed? I was when i found out the volume level of the motors in more modern devices is about 1/3rd that of the old ones. That's where the happiness ended. I was dubious about why you'd want a battery - I mean - the hell? Why make a device that will intentionally become 100% worthless within a few years instead of lasting perhaps as many as 20 if I wanted it to? Old electric shavers with ancient blades still work pretty good to my standard...<br /><br />Anyhow the deal breaker that made me stop using this sucker within 2 months and switch back? The mechanism to open it up and empty out the shavings inside is so idiotically designed that every time I would travel no matter how careful I was it would get popped open in my vanity bag and leak hair EVERYWHERE. Like putting a hair toothbrush in your mouth? Old shaver never did anything of the sort, and old shaver would never leak even if full of hair. I'm not used to this new age of emptying the hair constantly, I used to do it monthly or so.<br /><br />&#34;New&#34; technology, a huge step backwards.

  340. Got it for Christmas, Works better than more expensive razors I've had in the past. Best value. I've followed the charging instructions and use it 1-2 times a week, only had to charge it 3 times in the last 7 months. The trick is charge till full, and don't charge till dead. This is the best practice for all rechargeable batteries/devices. For 30 bucks I think its an absolute steal.
  341. I bought this in a deal in walmart with very reasonable price.But this is NOT good as I thought. It is very irritating when you use at neck region. Like said in the instructions I used it for 3 weeks to see the results.Its still the same so I returned it. I would not recommend this to a friend. Thanks
  342. Electric razor is cheap, good, much better than 20 year old Norelco it replaced. It gives a close shave, rarely needs to be recharged.
  343. Nice shaver, bought another brand earlier this year & absolutely hated it. The old one was hard to clean & put back together, this model is much easier to clean & even shaves closer than the fancy one I got rid of.
  344. First, I'm comparing the 7310XL to my old 7110X. The 7310 has more blades in its cutting head than the 7110. So in short, I find I get a better shave. But a better shave isn't everything. The blade guards on the 7110 seem to be of heavier, more refined construction than the 7310. So my old razor gave a more comfortable shave. I often found, however, that by the weekend I was ready for a razor shave. That may still be the case with the 7310 (new blades aways give a better shave that old ones); I guess I'll find that out later. One important note for travellers: Norelco no longer packages a case with the 7310. I guess that helps hold down costs, but it still means no case. If you have an old razor (like the 7110) the physical dimensions of the two razors are identical, so the 7110 case will work perfectly for the 7310. Lastly, my first razor was defective. For the very first time I needed to return something to Amazon. I went on line and printed the prepaid return label. On the day I mailed the defective razor, I found the replacement at my doorstep. Brava, Amazon!

  354. I was always skeptical about electric razors, since i have been using the traditional Gillete brand and fusion line and I always was just okay with it, wasn't too happy since it became a routine of wet face, shaving cream and cut myself. I dont get much facial hair anyways, so I never bothered to go above and beyond the traditional razor. However, once the sales hit this black friday, I was excited to see a Norelco for such an awesome price, so I figured I give it a try since i got gift cards and man, let me tell you I love this thing and from the trusted brand of electric razors too! Now i was a bit let down since the first couple of weeks it didnt cut as close or I was getting used to it. The instructions said it should take about 2 1/2 weeks to get used to it and I have loved it ever since. Its much more convienent and it eliminates the hassle for the shaving cream, so that saves some money there and the more you get used to it, you can shave in less than 3 mins. with a clear freash face. I highly recommend it, and I might upgrade the model in about 3-5 years depending on how long it lasts and judging by other reviews, this will last.

  356. Phillips Norelco no longer produces this model shaver. I can tell it wants to -- the heads attempt to turn -- but the razor simply wasn't getting enough power to keep them turning. (For the record, it shaved decently well for me when it was working.)<br /><br />My call to Phillips Norelco customer support was handled very effectively. They agreed to replace it with a PT720, a model currently in production as of this writing, as long as I sent back the defective 7310XL and charger upon receipt, which I will. (NOTE: Check reviews of the PT720 -- One review says it doesn't have a trimmer. The 7310XL does. So that is a difference, but I don't use the trimmer much anyway & so it wasn't important to me.)

  366. I hate shaving, Nair barely works, waxing is too messy, and I was unimpressed with a women's foil shaver I tried a number of years ago. I looked all over for information about women using men's shavers, and was largely unsuccessful. But I decided to give this shaver a shot, mostly because of the low cost and decent rating. This shaver turned out to be an excellent decision. Pros and cons are as follows: PRO: 1. Can be used while plugged in, so there are no worries about the battery dying while shaving a large area. 2. Does not have to be used in the shower, which allows one to save the cost of heating water, and also allows one to get into a more comfortable position while shaving difficult areas. 3. Very close shave. I was not impressed the first time, after shaving 3 weeks (!) worth of hair off my legs. Subsequent shaves were as close and smooth as if I used a razor. 4. Not noisy. It doesn't sound like I'm using a cheap vibrator while I shave my legs! 5. Significantly cheaper than regularly purchasing overpriced razors. CON: 1. Takes a little bit longer than using a regular razor - maybe an extra 10 minutes. I don't mind, though, as I can shave anytime, rather than just when I'm already taking a shower. 2. Misses little hairs here and there. It's not like a razor, and it does require going over certain areas a couple of times to get all the hair. I also shave my arms, and for some odd reason, this does not perform nearly as well on arms as it does on legs. But shaving my arms is not as big a hassle in the shower, so it's not an issue that affects my opinion of this product.

  377. I have had the Norelco 7310XL for a few weeks now, and overall, I'm pretty satisfied. The shaver has good and not so good points, so let's look at them. Pros: Very good shaving results on the relatively smooth, unobstructed parts of my face. Cheeks, chin and the neck are where this shaver shines. Just press lightly and move the shaver in a circular motion for a very close, quick and comfortable shave. Light weight and very quiet in operation. Much quieter than my old Braun shaver. Good battery life. Looks like the shaver will need a recharge no more than once per week. The recharging cord is long enough to allow you to use this as a corded shaver while it is recharging. That's a real convenience if you are in a hurry and find that your shaver battery is dead. Easy to clean. Just pop the top open, and rinse with hot water. Cons: The ergonomics of the shaving head leave a lot to be desired. The shaving head is big and bulky, and that makes it very awkward when you are trying to shave relatively small areas like your upper lip. This is the major drawback of this Norelco (and probably all rotary-type shavers), and I still often use my old Braun foil-type shaver on my lip. You must follow Norelco's instructions EXACTLY when shaving tender areas, such as your neck. Specifically, do not press the shaver too hard against your skin. If you do, you will be rewarded with Olympic-size skin irritation. I can personally vouch for the truth of this statement. ============================== I bought this shaver when my old Braun Free Control 1775 shaver began to show signs of needing a replacement shaving head, and I found that the price of the shaving head was too close to the price of a complete new shaver. So, I thought I would try this Norelco, which is in approximately the same price range as my Braun. i.e. They are both on the cheap end of their product lines. The bottom line on this Norelco is that it does some things reallywell, like shaving my cheeks and neck. It does these areas better and more quickly than my Braun foil-type shaver. But, the Norelco does some things badly, like shaving my upper lip. The Braun 1775 shaver's head gets into tight areas much better, but shaving is slower and noisier overall with the Braun. The real issue here is probably whether you like rotary or foil-type shavers. Both can be very good, but only at some aspects of shaving your face. As far at this particular Norelco goes, it seems to be a pretty good representative of the rotary type of shaver. If you like rotary shavers, this Norelco is probably as good as any. Whatever faults this Norelco may have seem to be common to all rotary shavers, and not because of any defect in this particular model. So, don't throw your money at the more expensive Norelcos, thinking that they will be better. You won't change the nature of the beast, you will just be getting a nicer looking beast with more bells and whistles.
  378. received razor in record time and have been using since its arrival. it performs very well and is as advertised.
  379. Motor seems to run slow, Blades may be dull.. All I know is it feels like it's yanking the hair rather than cutting it. Norelco made a decent shaver in the past but this one is so bad, I would send it back itf it were worth the time. Very Disappointing.

  382. The 7310 XL is my 5th Norelco shaver. I really like the washable shaving heads. Taking the thing apart and cleaning it has always been a hassle as far as I am concerned. As for my dislikes---This shaver does not hold a charge very long. I am lucky to get 7 shaves on one charge. My previous Norelco would hold a charge from 20-22 shaves. It was priced the same as the 7310 XL. I noticed my new shaver was manufactured in China. Is Norelco cutting corners on the quality? Maybe I am wrong, but I think they are. My previous shavers were made of better quality materials. The 7310 XL is made of very light materials and doesn't seem to be as sturdy. I would like to have one of the more expensive Norelcos, but I can't afford one. My biggest gripe of all is the cost involved in replacing the shaving heads. They cost almost as much as the shaver itself. Come on, Norelco. That is just plain ridiculous.
